poem:
Title: "Thread of Royal Blood"

In Goodman's guise, a crook we know,  
yet strains of blue reveal a glow.  
Five generations' shadowed tale  
unearthed, leaves Odenkirk's name awash in hail.  
Not a lawyer, slippery, sly, but kin  
to Charles, a hidden royal within.  
A TV reveal, unexpected twist,  
breaking bad's commoner — a royalist.  
That lineage does not a king construct,  
yet blood speaks truths in life's grand deduct.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Better Call Saul star Bob Odenkirk discovers he’s related to King Charles There’s very little that’s regal about Saul Goodman, the character Bob Odenkirk is best known for. But despite being famous for playing the slippery, con-loving lawyer in Breaking Bad and its prequel, Better Call Saul, the actor will discover on TV this week that he is related to royalty. Genealogy-based US television show Finding Your Roots has traced Odenkirk’s family back five generations". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
